questions.text: J..J. Thompson is credited with this model of the atom. What now-discarded model of the atom featured electrons dispersed randomly within a positive substance?
This phase of matter is considered to be incompressible. Which phase of matter keeps its volume constant under constant temperature but will take the shape of its container?
The diagram shows information about oxygen taken from a periodic table. How many protons does an oxygen atom possess?

cards.image:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="200" height="260" viewBox="0 0 200 260"><path fill="#fff" stroke="#000" stroke-width="2" d="M1 1h198v258H1z"/><text x="100" y="36" text-anchor="middle" font-family="system-ui, Arial, sans-serif" font-size="22" font-weight="600">
    8
  </text><text x="100" y="170" text-anchor="middle" font-family="system-ui, Arial, sans-serif" font-size="140" font-weight="700">
    O
  </text><text x="100" y="230" text-anchor="middle" font-family="system-ui, Arial, sans-serif" font-size="20">
    15.999
  </text></svg>

questions.text: Consider the chemical equation CaCO₃ —> CaO + CO₂. Which term best describes this reaction?
How much force to the nearest tenth newtons is required to move a 20-kg object at a constant acceleration of 3 meters per second?
Consider the transverse wave in the diagram. What property of the wave is represented by the arrow designated with an asterisk?

questions.text: A 200-kg object is moving north at 10 meters per second. If the object travels at a constant velocity for 60 seconds, how much momentum will it have during this time?
Of the following forms of electromagnetic radiation, which have the shortest wavelength and greatest amount of energy.
The Kelvin scale is an absolute temperature scale that is based on the value of absolute zero. Zero kelvin (0K) is equivalent of what temperature on the Celsius scale to the nearest whole degree?
This figure shown is a symbol from a circuit diagram. What circuit component does this represent?

cards.image: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 600 200" width="600" height="200"><rect width="100%" height="100%" fill="#fff"/><path d="M60 100h100m0 0 20-30 20 60 20-60 20 60 20-60 20 60 20-30m0 0h100" style="stroke:#111;stroke-width:4;fill:none;stroke-linecap:round;stroke-linejoin:round"/></svg>

questions.text: Energy can neither be created nor destroyed. What law suggests that the total amount of energy in in the Universe remains constant?
Match the cellular organelle with its function:

cards.image:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 900 200" width="900" height="200"><rect width="100%" height="100%" fill="#fff"/><defs><style>.text{font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-size:22px;fill:#000}.small{font-size:20px}</style></defs><path d="M20 20h860v160H20zm60 0v160M420 20v160m50-160v160M20 73h860M20 126h860" style="stroke:#000;stroke-width:2;fill:none"/><text class="text" x="45" y="55">X.</text><text class="text" x="45" y="108">Y.</text><text class="text" x="45" y="161">Z.</text><text class="text" x="100" y="55">ribosome</text><text class="text" x="100" y="108">smooth endoplasmic reticulum</text><text class="text" x="100" y="161">rough endoplasmic reticulum</text><text class="text" x="445" y="55">1.</text><text class="text" x="445" y="108">2.</text><text class="text" x="445" y="161">3.</text><text class="text small" x="490" y="55">
    synthesizes and transports fats and steroids
  </text><text class="text small" x="490" y="108">
    synthesizes proteins
  </text><text class="text small" x="490" y="161">
    transports proteins
  </text></svg>
